bibl.note: nombr. figg. et 8 pll. coul. + 24 pll. n./bl.

I. The Environment and Location of the Site. - II. History. - III. The Research Outline. - IV. The Strata of the Site. - V. The Remains of Structures. - VI. Objects. [The finds from the temple precinct are dated around the 1st to the 3rd century A.D.] - VII. [Japanese] Summary. - Pp. 287-289: English Summary: Waseda University Excavations at Malqata South: The First Three Seasons, December 1971 - February 1974. - See in part. pp. 220-225: Greek Ostraca [Paul HEILPORN]. Presents 42 Greek ostraka discovered in the course of the Waseda University Expedition at Malkata, Luxor, during the second season (in the Roman houses north-east of the Isis Temple of Deir al-Shalwit). At least 18 of them are tax receipts (for money, wheat or chaff), with dates ranging from AD 41 to the end of the 2nd cent. They give us the name by which this settlement was designated in Greek, Trikvm€a. Trikvm€a belonged to the Lower Toparchy of the Hermonthite nome. <Trikomia>
Malkata-South [V]. The Excavations of the Remains of Structures at the North Precinct of the Isis Temple (Deir al-Shalwit). [En japonais, avec résumé en anglais.]
Tokyo, Waseda University, Institute of Egyptology - Akht Press, 2005, 8°, xii-299 pp., nombr. figg. et 8 pll. coul. + 24 pll. n./bl. ISBN 4-903000-00-1.
